intro: Maianthemum tatsienense var. stenolobum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf false lily of the valley, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Convallariaceae and is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and small, white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers bloom in clusters at the base of the plant. This variety is distinguished by its stenolobum form, which refers to its narrow leaf lobes, making it unique within the species.
